boat.full_description:
Her first owner, Peter Rose, cruised 'Odd Times' across the Atlantic to the West Indies and up the Eastern Seaboard of the USA, New York, Buffalo, Chicago and Mississippi before returning to Britain.

This was Peter Rose's second Atlantic crossing. His earlier passage was in another boat named 'Odd Times', designed by John Leather and built for him in 1958. He sailed her from his native Essex coast to the Aegean and from Scotland to the Caribbbean, reaching Barbados in January 1966. He cruised the east coast of the USA as far as Iversterly, Rhode Island. The planned return voyage to England in 1967 ended in disaster and the loss of 'Odd Times' whilst under tow. The story is told in 'Sunk Without Trace: 30 dramatic accounts of yachts lost at sea' by Paul Gelder. Read an extract online.
boat.name: Odd Times
boat.short_description: This is one of several boats called 'Odd Times', all with a tale to be told.
